graphicslib3D

Class Matrix3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Matrix3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Matrix3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Defines a 3D (4x4) matrix for general transformations. Elements of the matrix are type double and are stored at (row,col) locations whose index values start at zero. Modeled loosely after the Java 2D "AffineTransform" class.
    Author:
    William Dimaculangan, John Clevenger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Matrix3D.MatrixInvert
      This class is a helper class supporting the Matrix3D class; it is not intended to be used directly.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Matrix3D(double[] values)
      Creates a Matrix3D containing the contents specified by the given double 'values' array.
      Matrix3D(double degrees, Vector3D axis)
      Creates a new Matrix3D containing the rotation transformation equivalent to a rotation of the specified angle (in degrees) about the specified axis.
      Matrix3D(float[] values)
      Creates a Matrix3D containing the contents specified by the given float 'values' array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix3D

        public Matrix3D()
        Creates a Matrix3D initialized to the identity matrix

      • Matrix3D

        public Matrix3D(double[] values)
        Creates a Matrix3D containing the contents specified by the given double 'values' array. The first four elements of 'values' are taken to be column 0, the second four are column one, etc. The input array is assumed to contain exactly 16 elements; otherwise, an error message is displayed and an unspecified result is returned.
        Parameters:
        values - A linear array containing in column-major order the values to be loaded into the matrix.

      • Matrix3D

        public Matrix3D(float[] values)
        Creates a Matrix3D containing the contents specified by the given float 'values' array. The first four elements of 'values' are taken to be column 0, the second four are column one, etc. The input array is assumed to contain exactly 16 elements; otherwise, an error message is displayed and an unspecified result is returned.
        Parameters:
        values - A linear array containing in column-major order the values to be loaded into the matrix.

      • Matrix3D

        public Matrix3D(double degrees,
                Vector3D axis)
        Creates a new Matrix3D containing the rotation transformation equivalent to a rotation of the specified angle (in degrees) about the specified axis.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle, given in degrees, specifying the rotation component of the matrix
        axis - The X,Y,Z components of the axis of rotation for the matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • elementAt

        public double elementAt(int row,
                        int col)
        Returns the element stored in this matrix at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        row - The row number in the matrix
        col - The column number in the matrix
        Returns:
        A double containing the data stored at [row,col] in the matrix

      • setElementAt

        public void setElementAt(int row,
                         int col,
                         double value)
        Sets the element stored in this matrix at the specified location to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        row - the row number in the matrix
        col - the column number in the matrix
        value - the value to be stored at [row,col] in the matrix

      • getRow

        public Vector3D getRow(int row)
        Returns a Vector3D containing in its XYZW fields the values currently stored in the specified row (0,1,2, or 3) of this matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the matrix
        Returns:
        a Vector3D containing in its four elements the four values from the specified row in the matrix

      • getCol

        public Vector3D getCol(int col)
        Returns a new Vector3D containing in its XYZW fields the values currently stored in the specified column (0,1,2, or 3) of this matrix.
        Parameters:
        col - The number of the column whose contents are to be returned
        Returns:
        A Vector3D containing the elements of the specified matrix column.

      • setRow

        public void setRow(int row,
                   Vector3D vector)
        Sets the specified row of this matrix to the XYZW values of the specified vector.
        Parameters:
        row - The row number which is to be set in this matrix
        vector - A Vector3D containing the values which are to be used to set the specified matrix row

      • setCol

        public void setCol(int col,
                   Vector3D vector)
        Sets the specified column of this matrix to the XYZW values of the specified vector.
        Parameters:
        col - The column number which is to be set in this matrix
        vector - A Vector3D containing the values which are to be used to set the specified matrix column

      • getValues

        public double[] getValues()
        Returns a 1-dimensional array of doubles containing the elements of this Matrix3D extracted in column order. That is, the first element (element zero) of the returned array contains the Matrix3D value at column zero, row zero; the second element contains the Matrix3D value at column zero, row one, etc.
        Returns:
        A one-dimensional array of doubles containing the elements of this matrix in column-major order

      • getFloatValues

        public float[] getFloatValues()
        Returns a 1-dimensional array of floats containing the elements of this Matrix3D extracted in column order. That is, the first element (element zero) of the returned array contains the Matrix3D value at column zero, row zero; the second element contains the Matrix3D value at column zero, row one, etc.
        Returns:
        A one-dimensional array of floats containing the elements of this matrix in column-major order

      • setValues

        public void setValues(double[] newValues)
        Loads the elements of this Matrix3D from a 16-element 1-dimensional array containing the elements arranged in column order. That is, the first element (element zero) of the specified array is stored the Matrix3D at column zero, row zero; the second element is stored in the Matrix3D at column zero, row one, etc.
        Parameters:
        newValues - A linear array representing, in column-major order, the values to be inserted into this matrix

      • concatenate

        public void concatenate(Matrix3D matrix2)
        Concatenates a second matrix onto this matrix on the right. That is, multiplies this matrix by the specified matrix, with the result [thisMatrix] = [thisMatrix] x [matrix2].
        Parameters:
        matrix2 - The matrix which is to be concatenated onto this matrix from the right

      • scale

        public void scale(double sx,
                  double sy,
                  double sz)
        Concatentates a scaling transformation onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(S) where S is a Matrix3D with the specified X,Y,Z scaling factors in the main diagonal.
        Parameters:
        sx - The scale amount in the X direction
        sy - The scale amount in the Y direction
        sz - The scale amount in the Z direction

      • translate

        public void translate(double tx,
                      double ty,
                      double tz)
        Concatentates a translation onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(T) where T is a Matrix3D with the specified X,Y,Z translation factors in rows 0, 1, and 2 of column 3.
        Parameters:
        tx - The translation amount in the X direction
        ty - The translation amount in the Y direction
        tz - The translation amount in the Z direction

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double degrees,
                   Vector3D axis)
        Concatenates onto this matrix a rotation of degrees about the specified axis.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle of rotation in degrees
        axis - The axis of rotation for the specified angle.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double xDegrees,
                   double yDegrees,
                   double zDegrees)
        Concatenates onto this matrix a rotation about the X, Y, and Z axes by the specified angles, which are assumed to be in degrees. The specified rotations are put into the matrix such that they are effectively performed in the order Y, then X, then Z.
        Parameters:
        xDegrees - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the X axis
        yDegrees - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the Y axis
        zDegrees - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the Z axis

      • rotateX

        public void rotateX(double degrees)
        Concatenates a rotation about the X axis by amount degrees onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(R) where R is a Matrix3D with the specified rotation angle about the X axis.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the X axis

      • rotateY

        public void rotateY(double degrees)
        Concatenates a rotation about the Y axis by amount degrees onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(R) where R is a Matrix3D with the specified rotation angle about the Y axis.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the Y axis

      • rotateZ

        public void rotateZ(double degrees)
        Concatenates a rotation about the Z axis by amount degrees onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(R) where R is a Matrix3D with the specified rotation angle about the Z axis.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the Z axis

      • setToIdentity

        public void setToIdentity()
        Initializes this matrix to the identity matrix.

      • inverse

        public Matrix3D inverse()
        Returns a new Matrix3D which is the inverse of this Matrix3D. Uses a Matrix3D.MatrixInvert helper class loaded with the same values as this Matrix3D to create the inverse, then copies the values from the inverted helper class matrix into a new Matrix3D which is returned. Does not alter the contents of this matrix.
        Returns:
        A Matrix3D containing the inverse transformation of this matrix.

      • transpose

        public Matrix3D transpose()
        Returns a new Matrix3D which is the transpose of this Matrix3D. Does not alter the contents of this matrix.
        Returns:
        a Matrix3D containing the transpose of this matrix

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a deep clone (copy) of this Matrix3D.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A Matrix3D which is a deep clone (copy) of this Matrix3D.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a printable representation of the contents of this matrix, formatted into row and columns via embedded newlines.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String containing the elements of the matrix in row-major order with newlines between rows
